clinical_study.brief_title: Predictors of CMR Related Parameters in STEMI Patients After Primary PCI and Its Correlation With Adverse Left Ventricular Remodeling and Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events
clinical_study.official_title: Predictors of CMR Related Parameters: Intramyocardial Hemorrhage, Microvascular Obstruction , Area at Risk and Strain Related Parameters, and Their Effects on Adverse Ventricular Remodeling and MACEs in STEMI Patients After Primary PCI

brief_summary.textblock: This study aim to investigate the association of CMR measured parameters: infarct size (IS), intramyocardial hemorrhage, microvascular obstruction , area at risk and CMR derived strain parameters with the risk of all-cause mortality and MACEs.

detailed_description.textblock: Investigators will enroll 800 patients with STEMI after PCI who were admitted to the Chinese PLA General Hospital between January 2014 and December 2019. CMR was performed at 7 days and 6 months after primary PCI to assess the final infarction size(IS), microvascular obstruction (MVO), intramyocardial hemorrhage(IMH), area at risk (AAR) and related strain parameters. All patients will be followed up by 5 years after addimission index. Cardiovascular events concluding stroke, repeat revascularization, rehospitalization for acute heart failure, nonfatal myocardial infarction, and all cause death. All adverse clinical events as well as study end points were monitored and adjudicated by the independent event committee.

primary_outcome.description: Cardiovascular events concluding stroke, repeat revascularization, rehospitalization for acute heart failure, nonfatal myocardial infarction

secondary_outcome.description: Myocardial infarct size is derived from MR delayed enhancement scan

intervention.description: Testing CMR on patients of 7 days and 6 months after myocardial infarction

study_pop.textblock: Investigators will enroll 800 patients with STEMI after PCI who were admitted to the Chinese PLA General Hospital between January 2014 and January 2019. CMR was performed at 7 days and 6 months after primary PCI to assess the final infarction size, microvascular obstruction (MVO), area at risk (AAR) and related strain parameters. All patients will be followed up by 5 years after addimission index.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 18-80 years.
2. clinically diagnosed ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction.
3. Intended to undergo emergency PCI.
4. Voluntary enrollment and signed informed consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. cardiogenic shock, papillary muscle rupture, ventricular septal perforation, episodes of ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation and post-electrical resuscitation, 3rd degree AVB, and temporary pacemaker implantation before PCI.
2. LVEF â‰¤ 30%.
3. combined aortic coarctation.
4. presence of valvular heart disease, congenital heart disease and history of pulmonary hypertension and other cardiomyopathies.
5. undergoing revascularization (PCI or CABG) within 6 months
6. contraindications to cardiovascular MRI.
7. current or within 3 months participation in other research studies.
8. Pregnant and lactating women.
9. those with severe mental impairment and unable to express their will
10. Patients with other significant abnormal signs, laboratory tests and clinical disease are unsuitable for participation in the study accessed by clinicians.

facility.name: Chinese People's Liberation Army General Hospital
